Overview: Inside Sales Representative

We are seeking a highly ambitious and effective individual who is equal parts creative, digitally savvy, and analytical to sell to and onboard new prospective clients of a fast-growing SaaS company. The Inside Sales Representative will work directly with Senior Managers, field sales personnel and collaborate with internal cross-functional teams. The Inside Sales Manager will spend the majority of their time in a prospect-finding, lead and demand generation role to understand the problem the prospect is trying to address and our offering as a potential solution.

He or she will assist the Sales Executives on relationship and rapport building with the prospects and will take proactive steps to ensure that any interaction with the client is architected for success. The ideal candidate has a history of success interacting with clients and creating relationships to drive to successful engagements and revenue attainment.

The main purpose of this role is to build an on-going profitable business relationship with netnew accounts. Candidates will be responsible for achieving revenue goals on a continuous basis by managing, building and developing a pipeline of software sales opportunities. This will involve building and developing relationships within an assigned territory and identifying new prospects for our Solutions.
This is a full-time position based in Milpitas, CA.

Develop and maintain close business relationships with key decision makers and influencers within client organizations
Present solutions to meet clients business needs and fulfil requirements
Manage, develop and own customer satisfaction for existing clients
Responsible for accurate and timely revenue forecasting and updates
Meeting or exceeding company standards for customer phone contact and documentation of customer interactions


Requirements:
Demonstrate passion for company, solutions, customers, and goals
Motivation to expand personal and professional knowledge of product and sales skills
Polished professionalism with above average organizational, planning, communication, and problem solving skills
Strong presentation skills
Proven ability to manage multiple concurrent sales cycles
Create and nurture strong collaborative relationships with field sales team members and internal stakeholders
Excellent written and verbal communications skills

ERP, WMS or Supply Chain experience

Java Platform Engineer


As a Platform Software Engineer, you will make an immediate impact on our products and clients by using the latest technologies such as Java 8, Spring 4 and RabbitMQ. You will be working on a variety of backend systems and data integration projects such as building data pipelines following a micro-services architecture and delivering RESTful web services for our mobile apps & business partners.


We also build software to crawl the social web for data, create Ruby on Rails apps to automate customer onboarding and iOS & Android mobile apps. Our versatile team takes pride in ownership and our engineers are involved right from the start in the architecture and design process. Our innovative Smart Sync technology uses Raspberry Pi hardware in the field with a command and control, cloud architecture. Everything we build is well tested and automation is a key focus.


We are looking for self motivated and intelligent individuals who take the initiative, are strong CS fundamentals and who are skilled collaborators but can also work independently. Using tools like Docker and Kubernetes to build 12Factor apps allows our Platform engineers to be highly productive and learn valuable skills quickly. This means you can design, develop and deploy your own projects and create value right away.


Responsibilities


Agile software development using Java 8
Create applications and tools to support data capture, transformation and publishing
Create tools to configure and audit data sources
Create automation to closely monitor incoming data for quality
Work with data providers and engineers to fix data issues
Collaborate with engagement managers and customers to identify and solve data problems
Qualifications


Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science
1 to 5 years of experience
In depth knowledge of Java, Spring and Ruby
Experience with queuing systems such as RabbitMQ, Kafka, Qpid or ActiveMQ
Demand for data quality and consistency
Strong desire for highest quality code and craftsmanship
Intuitive sense for spotting and investigating problems
Strong problem solving and communication skills

Location/City : CA - SAN FRANCISCO


Sr Node.js Engineer


need someone whos built middle tier services or platform development


As part of our web platform group, you will be building the libraries and infrastructure that all of our feature teams rely on every day. From our Node.js sets of libraries to our development and deployment pipeline. You will be helping us set the standards development not just for our immediate team, but all of the restaurant engineering web teams.


We are in the midst of breaking up our monolithic application into micro sites and services running on a range of tech stacks; Node.js for front and middle-tier, .Net (c#) and Java for backend services. All of this being built and deployed using Docker/Mesos and consumed through Angular.JS Single Page Applications. You will be a part of the team that continues to move this effort forward.


In addition to solving our application development challenges, you will be working with us to evolve our micro services/sites strategy to be easier to manage and iterate on. We have a growing list of internal clients to our libraries, so the challenges we face are a bit more complex than your normal set of development challenges. On top of our internal clients, we also have made some of our libraries available to the public and continuously innovating on our approaches impacts the public as well.


Overall, you will be helping us find and evaluate new ways of developing awesome features!



About you


You are a driven and dedicated software engineer, with an appetite for knowledge and a deep understanding of web technologies, including the latest standards and techniques. You excel at writing highly performant web applications with any technology you’ve had put in front of you.


You aim for perfection, but put pragmatism first. You're a quick learner with well-developed analytical and problem solving skills. You consider maintainability key at enterprise scale and value the more robust solution.

B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent

You love turning performance and making things faster

items.title: Data Scientist, User Identity
items.summary:
Category : Software Engineer
Location/City : CA - San Mateo


Data Scientist, User Identity
Job Description
Here is a good example, with a much smaller data scale, of the typical tasks that you will be working on.
We are developing a world leading digital-identity product that is a core driver of our company’s products and capabilities. This is a great opportunity for an outstanding candidate to build the core intellectual property of our highest-profile product from the ground up. The position will be focused on creative model building, performing analyses that explicate subtle facts from our data and development of highly-performant algorithms that can scale to datasets with tens of billions of samples. If you have a solid machine learning background, are looking to push your expertise way beyond the classroom and are excited at the prospect of going out of the box to solve difficult problems involving real-world data, this may be the opportunity for you!


What You Need For This Position
MS (PhD strongly preferred) in a highly quantitative field & strong aptitude toward creative problem solving and working with real-world data sets.
Prior experience in leveraging a strong mathematical foundation to solve research-level problems in data analysis and modeling.
Self-motivated, capable of independently driving analyses and have a strong ability to work in teams and communicate with others.
Experience with scalable, distributed, highly-performant computing systems is a big plus.
Proficient with scripting/prototyping languages (Python/R), with packages commonly used to do numerical analysis, statistical modeling and machine learning (numpy, scipy, pandas, Scikit-Learn, xGBoost, Theano, TensorFlow), and with packages typically used to visualize data (matplotlib, seaborn, jupyter, ggplot, D3, shiny).
Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Spark, MapReduce or other related big data technology experience or aptitude. Java programming skill is not required, but would be a bonus.
Experience in diverse corners of machine learning and mathematics is a plus (classical statistics, optimization, graph algorithms, semi-supervised learning, recommendation systems, deep learning, etc.).
Previous experience in Ad-Tech, Mar-Tech or Identity Management industries is a bonus.


What You'll Do
Conduct applied research and have a huge end-to-end impact on key product initiatives.
Focused on probabilistic digital identity, understanding users via their digital footprint, finding signal in noisy observational data.
Collaborate with teams at all levels to greatly impact the company’s' direction and capabilities with your vision, passion and execution.
Working with the latest open source technology on highly-performant and scalable data products.

items.title: Senior iOS Software Engineer
items.summary:
Category : Mobile Software- iOS
Location/City : CA - SAN FRANCISCO


Senior iOS Software Engineer


You will be part of the small and highly talented iOS consumer team, taking our universal app to next level - payments, personalization, social (that’s not corporate-speak for “Facebook integration”).
You’ll implement new features, explore prototypes with our in-house design team and work with our machine learning team to take our recommendations to the next level. We operate at a high scale, your work will be used by millions every day.
Our roadmap is packed, and we’re done playing catch up with the website, so it’s all mobile only now.


We understand mobile (and how important it is)
We started off as a consumer website more than 10 years ago. We are on track to become a consumer mobile company that happens to have a wired website.
Our app has been on the store since 2009. We’re one of the rare companies that can claim to be integrated with Siri. On top of that, we have been prominently featured in the last three iPhone launch events.



We’re an engineering driven organization
We’re a tech company first and foremost, backed by very sharp product teams that have a thorough understanding of the restaurant industry.


The best product ideas are nothing if they can’t be executed properly at high scale, and our management knows that. Engineers drive innovation, and constantly challenge status quo. Each team member can have a meaningful impact on the product, helping shape our company’s future.



About you
You are a solid engineer, with an appetite for knowledge and a deep understanding of native mobile apps specificities —resource constraints, deployment issues, very short usage spans etc. You also have good knowledge of the main iOS core frameworks —UIKit, CoreGraphics, CoreAnimation, GCD. You’re more than familiar with Objective-C, and your Object Oriented skills don’t pale.
You are a pragmatic, quick learner, with excellent analytical and problem solving skills. Maintainability is key at our scale, and a slightly slower but more robust code is often preferable to the very clever faster solution.
You are easy to work with and communicate well with others. You also enjoy learning from others, and sharing your knowledge with the team. We’re looking for talented people who are happy to work with others, while still pushing themselves to continue getting better at their craft.


How we work:
We’re agile, and that’s not just a buzzword —we use a Kanban board and re-prioritize stories and features as needed (wink, wink, iOS 7 8;-)). We’re small and we move fast. We sometimes break things, and learn from it.
We embrace open source —CocoaPods, AFNetworking, TimesSquare, KIF. We don’t just use it, we contribute back when needed.
We’re also bleeding edge. Technology evolves too fast in the mobile space for us to sit aside a wait for something to gain traction, so we try to set the trend.
We pay off technical debt early and learn from past mistakes. All iOS 6 specific code? Gone. NSURLConnection? You mean NSURLSession, right :) Oh, hello TextKit! where have you been all my life?



Perks
Beautiful office space in downtown San Francisco, adjacent to Montgomery BART station
Flexible hours
Access to conferences, books, and learning resources
Want to speak at conferences? We’ll help you make it happen
Host your MeetUp here (we’ll pick up the tab)
Offices around the globe
Generous benefits and time off
RSUs -- everybody benefits from shared success
And the best part? People you enjoy seeing every day.

Sr Product Designer

Primarily UI Visual design skills inside the apps (iOS / Android / Web).  This role is a "Product" design role specifically.  It reports to the Head of Product and currently manages 1 other visual designer.  Our marketing-design team is separate, and while they collaborate directly together, we do not have a Head of Design at this point that oversees all of our design.

Should have some decent experience on both native-mobile and web products. Ideally direct-to-consumer applications. B2B and internal applications are less appealing.



Looking for a naturally gifted, highly motivated professional to join our outstanding design team.
We are passionate about design—in all its forms—we put the highest value on our ability to create experiences that continually delight and engage our audience.  We approach design solutions with an empathetic, holistic view, discussing ideas around a whiteboard before prototyping and iterating our assumptions.  We work tirelessly to solicit feedback from the real people using our products and incorporate those findings into the final release.  We embrace best practices but continually aspire to create solutions that take us beyond the obvious.
You:  A talented, hard working human being who is hungry to do big things. Someone who knows what it's like to work hard, but also wants to have a life. Your attention to detail and aesthetic sensibilities are keen, and you are excited to use them to implement consistent, seamless, cross-platform experiences for students worldwide. You grasp complex product workflows and can wireframe in your sleep. You know the difference between usability and design, but you appreciate both. You don't want to spend all your time with boxes and arrows because you love UI visual design just the same. You understand and embrace the user-experience differences that exist among Desktop browsers, iOS, Android, and the Mobile Web. You excel at pushing the proverbial envelope while developing new features. You're confident you can work closely with our designers and engineers to help create a pixel-perfect product that shines.
The Job:  As Senior Product Designer you'll move product from sketching (wireframes and workflows) to shipping (hi-res comps and production-ready assets). You'll work closely with and lead the product design team to ensure our designs embody and/or extend user experience, brand identity and business goal requirements. You'll also collaborate with developers to ensure your designs are realized in the way you intended.
Responsibilities:
Define and lead product design strategy across all platforms (iOS / Android / Web).  Execute tactically against strategy.
Understand complex product requirements, and translate them into simple / intuitive user interfaces across web, mobile, and tablet devices.
Create pixel perfect user experience wire frames, prototypes, and mockups.
Work closely with Marketing, Product Managers, Engineers, and QA to bring designs to life.
Qualifications:
BA/BS/BFA in Graphic Design, HCI, Industrial Design, or related field with 5+ years (or MA/MS with 3+ years, or 8+ years) of relevant professional work experience in user experience design / interaction design / product design field.
Strong track record of delivering the most intuitive user experience through original wireframes, and prototypes.
A compelling portfolio of sketches, wireframes, prototypes, hi-res comps, etc. that clearly expresses your ability to create successful design solutions.
Experience delivering complex product flows that span web, tablet, and mobile form factors, serving millions of users.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Fluency in Illustrator, Photoshop, & the like.
Teamwork comes standard.
Great attention to details.
Nice to have:
Keen eye for observing that "A-ha!" moment with our users.
Effectively partner with product managers, engineers and other stakeholders to help deliver a product's design goals and business vision.
A continuing commitment to expanding your professional knowledge and staying current with design trends.
Self starter.
Awesome Beer Brewing skills.

Head of Product or Head of Product Management


This person will ideally be comfortable managing the Product Design Team as well as the Product Managers. However, to start, they will be the single product manager (i.e. need to role up their sleeves). They will be growing that team, not starting with an existing one. Our Product Design team is currently comprised of 2 product designers. have to be a leader and a doer. Not afraid to be intimately involved in PRD / JIRA up front. Don't oversee the entire product development lifecycle (i.e. design / engr / qa), but rather just product design for now.


You: You are singularly customer-focused. You’re prewired to empathize – you’re a keen observer and active listener. You can boil feedback into core problems and deliver product experiences that solve them. You can put a dot on a map then chart a path to get there, knowing full-well that the path will change along the way. You can wrangle intelligent, divergent points-of-view into an aligned, actionable plan. You can see, instinctively, whether a challenge is better solved by innovation or imitation. You believe there’s a time and place for each. You can articulate your point of view. You can articulate opposing points of view. You enable and encourage honest, direct communication across the team. You can get it done. You have a bias for action. You slide a chair up to the teammate that needs sitting-by. You hustle. You should be Head of Product here. You can change education for better, forever.


The Job: Head of Product oversees the organization, scheduling, requirement gathering and designs of the entire product roadmap. They manage the product design team and product management. They are both a do’er and director for a growth stage business? that requires rolling up sleeves for hands on product specification one minute, and changing the direction of product plans to increase customer value the next. They work closely with the CEO to set the product strategy. Reports to CEO. Works alongside Heads of Marketing, Engineering and Ops.


Responsibilities:
Work with CEO to set product roadmap strategy. Execute tactically against the strategy.
Manage and grow the product design team.
Build out the product management team.
Work closely with Head of Engineering, Head of Marketing, Head of Operations and Head of Strategic Business to collect all product input.
Prepare necessary requirements, design and detail to help Head of Engineering drive the SDLC.
Serve as lead Product Manager, including:
Author PRDs that direct design & development. Revisit and revise accordingly throughout the process.
Plan and execute qualitative, quantitative, formal and informal research.
Drive product initiatives from research through kickoff, design/development, shipment, followup-research and iteration (rinse & repeat).
Specify and monitor product KPIs on an ongoing basis.
Specify and oversee A/B tests on an ongoing basis.
Qualifications:
5+ years PM and/or Director experience.
Demonstrable passion for, and opinionated point-of-view of, product design and development.
Excellent communication – verbal, visual, any and all. Confidence expressing yourself with bulletpoints and boxes-and-arrows alike.
Mobile- and web-application experience.
Please plan to share sample roadmaps, PRDs, and/or research (any format is fine) that you’ve developed in the past.
Nice to have:
Design and/or development background.
Familiarity with A/B testing methodologies.
Experience conducting informal and formal focus groups.
Experience with Product Analytics (i.e. Google Analytics) and DB Metrics.

-look for any hint of a personality characteristic that could be seen as being problematic in aligning to our culture

Product Management Philosophy
-demonstrated passion about product management
-passion for identifying and solving customer problems
-customer-centric in approach to problem solving and requirements gathering
-use data to validate product opportunities and measure impact of product work
-demonstrated ability to id and validate a customer problem, prioritize reqs, communicate clear ux requirements through wireframes, deliver clear and concise specs

PM Chops
-practical, hands-on experience operating within scrum/agile framework; strong handle on ux shown through experience with wire framing and examples of applied UCD principles (user research)
-familiarity with modern tools used for agile project management and planning, road maps/light weight reqs mgmt & specs/backlog/wireframes/analytics
-passion and practical experience with applying data-driven methods to build better products, optimize, etc.
-demonstrated street cred with devs

Work Experience
-logical evolution of progression in their career or a clear 'story' for where they are and why they're talking with us
-evidence of business achievements/success
-relatively recent experience working within a smaller, intimate company environment
-demonstrated self-starter
-a recent innovation play (feature or product)
-awesome references and testimonials

Us
-demonstrated and genuine interest in our mission
-their motivators align with what we can offer
-asks thoughtful, intelligent questions about our business/market/vision

Bonus points:
-unique industry passion/experience
-former designer/developer
-has a unique applicable skill not found here today that could help the biz
-product type or class that directly matches ours (CRM, dashboard, promo mgmt, surveys, etc.)
-mobile plus web
-B2B and B2C

items.title: Senior Product Designer
items.summary:
Category : Web Designer
Location/City : CA - San Francisco


Senior Product Designer


Looking for a naturally gifted, highly motivated professional to join our outstanding design team.


We are passionate about design—in all its forms—we put the highest value on our ability to create experiences that continually delight and engage our audience. We approach design solutions with an empathetic, holistic view, discussing ideas around a whiteboard before prototyping and iterating our assumptions. We work tirelessly to solicit feedback from the real people using our products and incorporate those findings into the final release. We embrace best practices but continually aspire to create solutions that take us beyond the obvious.


You: A talented, hard working human being who is hungry to do big things. Someone who knows what it’s like to work hard, but also wants to have a life. Your attention to detail and aesthetic sensibilities are keen, and you are excited to use them to implement consistent, seamless, cross-platform experiences for students worldwide. You grasp complex product workflows and can wireframe in your sleep. You know the difference between usability and design, but you appreciate both. You don’t want to spend all your time with boxes and arrows because you love UI visual design just the same. You understand and embrace the user-experience differences that exist among Desktop browsers, iOS, Android, and the Mobile Web. You excel at pushing the proverbial envelope while developing new features. You’re confident you can work closely with our designers and engineers to help create a pixel-perfect product that shines.


The Job: As Senior Product Designer you’ll move product from sketching (wireframes and workflows) to shipping (hi-res comps and production-ready assets). You’ll work closely with and lead the design team to ensure our designs embody and/or extend user experience, brand identity and business goal requirements. You’ll also collaborate with developers to ensure your designs are realized in the way you intended.
Responsibilities:


Define and lead product design strategy across all platforms. Execute tactically against strategy.
Understand complex product requirements, and translate them into simple / intuitive user interfaces across web, mobile, and tablet devices.
Create pixel perfect user experience wire frames, prototypes, and mockups.
Work closely with Marketing, Product Managers, Engineers, and QA to bring designs to life.


Qualifications:


BA/BS/BFA in Graphic Design, HCI, Industrial Design, or related field with 5+ years (or MA/MS with 3+ years, or 8+ years) of relevant professional work experience in user experience design / interaction design / product design field.
Strong track record of delivering the most intuitive user experience through original wireframes, and prototypes.
A compelling portfolio of sketches, wireframes, prototypes, hi-res comps, etc. that clearly expresses your ability to create successful design solutions.
Experience delivering complex product flows that span web, tablet, and mobile form factors, serving millions of users.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Fluency in Illustrator, Photoshop, & the like.
Teamwork comes standard.
Great attention to details.


Nice to have:


Keen eye for observing that “A-ha!” moment with our users.
Effectively partner with product managers, engineers and other stakeholders to help deliver a product’s design goals and business vision.
A continuing commitment to expanding your professional knowledge and staying current with design trends.
Self starter.
Awesome Beer Brewing skills.
